intro: Collare-stuartense multistellare, commonly known as the star-studded collare, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its intricate, star-shaped flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep orange. The plant features a compact, bushy growth habit with numerous small, clustered stems. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its unique appearance. Botanically, it belongs to the family Asteraceae, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils.
